title: What are the most interesting concepts in astronomy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Number 1 on my list is Astrophysics:Dark Energy and Dark Matter and their relationship to the formation and structure of the Universe. https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dark_energy The Structure and Physics of Singularities: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_holeIn  Observational Astronomy: Exoplanets. "An exoplanet or extrasolar planet is aplanet that orbits a star other than the Sun. Over 2000 exoplanets have been discovered since 1988 (2074 planets in1321 planetary systems including 507 multiple planetary systems as of 16 February 2016)." https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exoplanet These are my favorites.  The search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence is interesting too, but I wonder if we are going about it intelligently. Maybe we need more Terrestrial Intelligence.

I like the fact we are made of star stuff but that is already taken. Hmmm I would say that complex molecules and compounds (humans) research what they are made of. Atoms researching atoms :) Bot food/ sacrifice: Shameless plug of my project I am working on: EV Pennyboard
